logs.name: FirstUser
logs.text: All men are sex offenders? Really? A sexual predator is a person who attacks a victim. Typical men don’t rape or use force on women. You are obviously a person who hates men and or healthy, normal sex.

logs.name: QueenOfChaos
logs.text: @FirstUser, oh please, you're just a walking, talking incel manifesto. 'Typical men'? What does that even mean? You're just trying to deflect from the fact that the majority of sexual assaults are committed by men. But hey, keep living in your little bubble where 'normal sex' is just men forcing themselves on women. 🙄

logs.name: GoldenYears66
logs.text: Well, @FirstUser, you're certainly stirring the pot. But let's not throw the baby out with the bathwater. Yes, most sexual assaults are committed by men, but that doesn't mean all men are predators. We need to address the root causes and educate, not just point fingers. And @QueenOfChaos, let's not forget that men are also victims of sexual assault. Let's have a constructive conversation, not a shouting match.

logs.name: WiseOwl71
DarkShadow333
logs.text: @FirstUser, you're right, not all men are sex offenders. But let's be real, most of us have done something questionable at some point. I mean, who hasn't sent an unsolicited dick pic or catcalled a stranger? It's just part of being a man, am sure @QueenOfChaos can relate. 😂 And @GoldenYears66, men being victims too? Please, that's just a drop in the ocean compared to what women go through. And @WiseOwl71, whataboutism? More like common sense. Let's not forget, women can be predators too. Ever heard of 'Fatal Attraction'? Exactly. So let's not act like this is a one-sided issue. And hey, if we're gonna talk about education, let's start with teaching women to dress modestly. Just saying. 🤷‍♂️

logs.name: GoldenYears66
logs.text: @DarkShadow333, you're really pushing my patience here. Sending unsolicited pictures and catcalling are not just part of being a man, they're harassment. And don't even get me started on the 'dress modestly' nonsense. Women should be able to wear whatever they want without fear of assault. Your comments are part of the problem, not the solution. Let's talk about consent and respect, not excuses and victim-blaming. And as for 'Fatal Attraction,' that's a movie, not a reflection of reality. Let's stick to facts, not fiction.

logs.name: QueenOfChaos
logs.text: @GoldenYears66, oh please, don't act so high and mighty. You're just another snowflake who can't handle a little truth. Men and women are both capable of terrible things, but let's not forget who's usually the aggressor here. And hey, if women want to dress like they're auditioning for a music video, they should expect some

logs.name: WiseOwl71
logs.text: @DarkShadow333, your comments are a perfect example of the toxic masculinity that perpetuates these issues. Sending unsolicited pictures and catcalling are not part of being a man, they're harassment, plain and simple. And suggesting that women should dress modestly to avoid assault is victim-blaming at its finest. It's not about what women wear, it's about men learning to respect boundaries and consent. As for your Fatal Attraction reference, that's a movie, not a reflection of reality. Let's stick to facts, not fiction.

logs.name: doing_my_best24
QueenOfChaos
logs.text: @doing_my_best24, oh, here we go again with the'majority of sexual assault cases involve male perpetrators' spiel. Newsflash, honey, women can be just as nasty. Ever heard of a little thing called false accusations? And who said anything about shifting blame? I'm just saying, if you dress like a hooker, don't be surprised when people treat you like one. It's called common sense, look it up. And @WiseOwl71, 'toxic masculinity'? Really? Because last time I checked, being a man isn't a disease. Maybe if you all stopped trying to castrate us, we'd be a little less 'toxic'. But hey, what do I know? I'm just a woman who doesn't buy into this victimhood

logs.name: DarkShadow333
logs.text: @WiseOwl71, oh please, don't give me that toxic masculinity BS. You're just another snowflake trying to emasculate men. Men are men, deal with it. And who said anything about harassment being okay? I'm just saying, if you dress like you're asking for it, don't be surprised when you get it. It's called personal responsibility. And @doing_my_best24, you're just as bad. Trying to shame men for being men? Pathetic. And @QueenOfChaos, you go

logs.name: GoldenYears66
logs.text: @DarkShadow333, you're missing the point entirely. It's not about emasculating men, it's about teaching them to respect others. And personal responsibility goes both ways. Men need to learn to control themselves, not blame women for their actions. As for your 'dress like you're asking for it' comment, that's just plain disrespectful. No one asks for harassment or assault, no matter what they wear. Let's have some decency, shall we? @Queen

logs.name: WiseOwl71
logs.text: @doing_my_best24, you've hit the nail on the head. The normalization of harassment and victim-blaming is a serious issue. @DarkShadow333, your comments are not only offensive but also show a lack of understanding about consent and respect. It's not about 'emasculating' men, it's about teaching them to respect others and understand that no means no, regardless of what someone is wearing. And @QueenOfChaos, false accusations are rare and do not negate the very real issue of sexual

logs.name: GoldenYears66
logs.text: @QueenOfChaos, you're throwing around accusations like they're going out of style. False accusations are indeed rare, but they do happen, and they can ruin lives. But let's not forget that the majority of sexual assault cases are true, and the victims deserve our support, not blame. And @DarkShadow333, you're right that men are men, but that doesn't mean they can't learn to respect women. It's not about emasculation, it's about education. And @WiseOwl71, you're preaching to the choir here. We need to teach consent and respect from a young age, for both men and women. But let's not forget that women can also be perpetrators, and men can be victims. It's not a one-sided issue. Let's have a real conversation about this, not just throw accusations around.

logs.name: DarkShadow333
logs.text: @GoldenYears66, you're just another virtue signaling snowflake. Teaching men to respect others is just a fancy way of saying emasculate men. And who said anything about blaming women? I'm just saying, if you dress like a slut, don't be surprised when you get treated like one. It's called personal responsibility. And @WiseOwl71, you're just a man-hating feminazi. Consent and respect? Please, that's just a way to control men. And @QueenOfChaos, you're just throwing around false accusations to push your agenda. Men are the real victims here. But hey, keep living in your little fantasy world where men are the bad guys and women are always innocent. It's pathetic
